byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and WAYNE ARNOLD

abstract: Reuters BreakingViews column notes banking regulators are devising framework for Volcker Rule, intended to govern types of investments banks can make, but remain murky on what constitutes short-term or near-term trading; points out South Korean banks and government finances look steady, but economic slump centered on indebted households is a real risk.
snippet: America’s banking regulators have taken a good stab at devising a framework for the Volcker Rule on proprietary trading by banks, but it still leaves gray areas.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: America’s banking regulators have taken a good stab at devising a framework for the Volcker Rule on proprietary trading by banks, but it still leaves gray areas.

headline.main: Volcker Rule Could Leave Some Murky Wiggle Room
headline.seo: Volcker Rule Could Leave Some Murky Wiggle Room
